title: How to Make Fried Cookies

steps.headline: In a large bowl beat together eggs and sugar.
steps.description: When a thick and light color stop.

steps.headline: Then beat in shortening, brandy, anise seeds (optional) and salt.
Beat in the flour gradually.
steps.description: Be careful not to beat to fast to avoid spilling.

steps.headline: Flour a surface and knead the dough into a soft ball.
steps.description: Divide the ball into two equal pieces, wrap then in waxed paper and chill in refrigerator for at least two hours.

steps.headline: Roll one piece of dough into a rectangle approximately 12 x 15 inches.
steps.description: The other piece of dough should be left in the refrigerator until its ready to be rolled. Using pastry wheel, cut the dough into strips 6 x 1 inch.

steps.headline: Make a vertical slit in top 1/3 of the strip.
steps.description: Draw the bottom end of it through OR tie a knot in the center. Repeat with remaining dough and set aside.

steps.headline: Heat some oil in a deep frying pan to 360 degrees F
(185 degrees C).
steps.description: Deep fry the strips until golden brown. Drain on paper towels, cool, and sprinkle heavily with confectioners' sugar.

text: In a large bowl beat together eggs and sugar. When a thick and light color stop. Then beat in shortening, brandy, anise seeds (optional) and salt.  Beat in the flour gradually. Be careful not to beat to fast to avoid spilling. Flour a surface and knead the dough into a soft ball. Divide the ball into two equal pieces, wrap then in waxed paper and chill in refrigerator for at least two hours. Roll one piece of dough into a rectangle approximately 12 x 15 inches. The other piece of dough should be left in the refrigerator until its ready to be rolled. Using pastry wheel, cut the dough into strips 6 x 1 inch. Make a vertical slit in top 1/3 of the strip. Draw the bottom end of it through OR tie a knot in the center. Repeat with remaining dough and set aside. Heat some oil in a deep frying pan to 360 degrees F  (185 degrees C). Deep fry the strips until golden brown. Drain on paper towels, cool, and sprinkle heavily with confectioners' sugar. Finished.
